SENT.plain: Bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) is a common condition but is only rarely associated with embolic complications
We describe a 42-year-old man with recurrent posterior circulatory ischemic strokes that resulted in ataxia and cognitive impairment
Transesophageal echocardiography demonstrated a BAV with mild stenosis, moderate calcification, and a dilated ascending aorta
The degree of calcification and the valve phenotype might be important factors implicating the BAV as a rare cause of ischemic stroke
